intro: Stachytarpheta rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
